trans-unit.source: Provides text writer functionality for devices targeted by the HTML adapter set.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
for operating in a hosted environment.
Demand value: <see cref="F:System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction.InheritanceDemand" />; Permission value: <see cref="F:System.Web.AspNetHostingPermissionLevel.Minimal" />.
The base writer object.
An object of <see cref="T:System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities" /> class that provides the capability information for the specific device.
Creates a new instance of the specified class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Adapters are usually constructed automatically by ASP.NET and must have a default constructor.
trans-unit.target: 配接器通常由 ASP.NET 自動建構，而且必須具有預設建構函式。

trans-unit.source: Starts a new Style block.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlMobileTextWriter.EndStyleContext%2A> method to complete the Style block.
Completes a new Style block.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlMobileTextWriter.BeginStyleContext%2A> method to start the Style block.
The style reference.
Begins a block by using the character formatting from a specified style.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The style reference.
Begins a block by using the layout and character formatting from a given style.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The style reference.
Begins a block by using the layout and character formatting from a given style.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlMobileTextWriter.EnterStyle%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlMobileTextWriter.ExitStyle%2A> methods allow a device adapter to emit markup, in order to begin and end a block using the character formatting from a given style.
trans-unit.target: <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlMobileTextWriter.EnterStyle%2A>和<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlMobileTextWriter.ExitStyle%2A>方法，可讓裝置配接器發出標記，以便開始及結束使用指定樣式的格式設定字元的區塊。

trans-unit.source: Removes the current style, restores the previous style as the current formatting style, and optionally calls the <see cref="M:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.WriteEndTag(System.String)" /> method to close the current element.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The style reference.
Ends a block that has been using the character formatting from a specified style.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The style reference.
If <c>breakAfter</c> is <see langword="true" />, a break is added after the closing style element.
Ends a block that has been using the character formatting from a specified style.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

Removes the current style, restores the previous style as the current formatting style, and optionally calls the <see cref="M:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.WriteEndTag(System.String)" /> method to close the current element.
The style reference.

Removes the current style, restores the previous style as the current layout style, and optionally calls the <see cref="M:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.WriteEndTag(System.String)" /> method to close the current element.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The style reference.
If <c>breakAfter</c> is <see langword="true" />, a break is added after the closing style element.

Removes the current style, restores the previous style as the current layout style, and optionally calls the <see cref="M:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.WriteEndTag(System.String)" /> method to close the current element.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Ends a block that has been using the layout and character formatting from a given style.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

Ends a block that has been using the layout and character formatting from a given style.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The style reference.
If <c>breakAfter</c> is <see langword="true" />, a break is added after the closing style element.
Ends a block that has been using the layout and character formatting from a given style.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Marks the beginning of a style context.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Indicates whether the body color attribute can be sent to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
<see langword="true" /> if the body color attribute can be sent to the output stream; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
trans-unit.target: <see langword="true" /> 如果主體色彩屬性可以傳送到輸出資料流。否則， <see langword="false" />。

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether the bold attribute can be sent to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
<see langword="true" /> if the bold attribute can be sent to the output stream; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
trans-unit.target: <see langword="true" /> 如果粗體屬性可以傳送到輸出資料流。否則， <see langword="false" />。

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether the alignment attribute can be sent to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
<see langword="true" /> if the alignment attribute can be sent to the output stream; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
trans-unit.target: <see langword="true" /> 如果對齊屬性可以傳送到輸出資料流。否則， <see langword="false" />。

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether the target device supports the <see langword="NoWrap" /> value for text wrapping.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
<see langword="true" /> if the target device supports the <see langword="NoWrap" /> value for text wrapping; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
trans-unit.target: <see langword="true" /> 如果目標裝置支援<see langword="NoWrap" />值的文字換行; 否則<see langword="false" />。

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether the font color attribute can be sent to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
<see langword="true" /> if the font color attribute can be sent to the output stream; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
trans-unit.target: <see langword="true" /> 如果字型色彩屬性可以傳送到輸出資料流。否則， <see langword="false" />。

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether the font name attribute can be sent to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
<see langword="true" /> if the font name attribute can be sent to the output stream; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
trans-unit.target: <see langword="true" /> 如果字型名稱屬性可以傳送到輸出資料流。否則， <see langword="false" />。

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether the font size attribute can be sent to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
<see langword="true" /> if the font size attribute can be sent to the output stream; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.

trans-unit.source: Contains a Boolean value that indicates whether to send the <see langword="italic" /> attribute to the target device.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
<see langword="true" /> if the <see langword="italic" /> attribute can be sent to the target device; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
trans-unit.target: <see langword="true" /> 如果<see langword="italic" />屬性可以是傳送到目標裝置，否則<see langword="false" />。

trans-unit.source: Gets a value indicating whether the device does not support HTML <see langword="< br >" /> elements to format line breaks.
The default is <see langword="false" />.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
<see langword="true" /> if the device does not support HTML <see langword="< br >" /> tags; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
trans-unit.target: <see langword="true" /> 如果裝置不支援 HTML<see langword="< br >" />標記; 否則<see langword="false" />。

trans-unit.source: Closes a style context.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Writes an attribute and its value to the current element.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The character to write to the output stream.
Writes the given character to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The text to write to the output stream.
Writes the text to the output stream, along with any pending tab spacing.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
None
Writes any tab spacing and the opening tag of the specified markup element to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Writes a line break.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The text to encode and write to the output stream.
Encodes the specified text for the requesting device, and then writes it to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
None
Writes any tab spacing and the opening tag of the specified markup element to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The name of the hidden field.
The value of the hidden field.
Writes a hidden field with the given name and value.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A hidden field is in the form \<input type="hidden" name="name" value="value">.
trans-unit.target: 隱藏的欄位的格式為\<輸入類型 ="hidden"name ="name"value ="value">。

trans-unit.source: The line terminator string to write.
Writes a line terminator string to the output stream.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The text to write.
If <see langword="true" />, encodes the text.
Writes the given text, optionally with encoding.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Encoding involves mapping characters with HTML/WML meanings to the appropriate character code.
trans-unit.target: 編碼涉及對應至適當的字元程式碼的 HTML/WML 意義的字元。

trans-unit.source: The parameter name to encode and write.
The parameter value to encode and write.
Writes an encoded URL parameter.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The parameter is written in the form `name=value`.
